intro: Rhexia pungens, commonly known as the pricklyweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer. Rhexia pungens is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woods and along stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
